description.narrative: By 2019, domestic actors have enhanced capacity for development of child-sensitive policies and plans, as well as the consideration of social accountability in public processes.

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, domestic actors have enhanced capacity for development of child-sensitive policies and plans, as well as the consideration of social accountability in public processes.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF supported the Government in implementing the PNACC initiative. Technical assistance was provided to key decentralization actors at both central and local levels. In addition, UNICEF built strong partnership with the Government and key decentralization stakeholders to support the 40 convergence municipalities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Local government (incl. municipalities) with budget allocated to child priorities
Local governments (incl. municipalities) with functioning social accountability mechanisms
Local governments (incl. municipalities) with functioning coordination mechanisms to strengthen the delivery of child focused services
Citizens (including children) empowered to participate in (sub)national budget process to improve budget transparency and accountability
